name: Light-Dependent Resistor (LDR)
description: A light detector with wide dynamic range.

name: Photo transistor
description: A light detector with a very fast response time. Often has a lens which makes them sensitive to direction.

name: LED light sensor
description: LEDs can work in reverse, generating a tiny amount of power when light shines onto them. Slow response time.
Red LEDs are best for detecting visible light.

name: Button
description: An electro-mechanical device providing physical on-off control.
Buttons can be momentary or latching types, and come in many forms such as push buttons, toggle switches, and bumper switches.

name: Potentiometer (Pot)
description: A variable resistor, usually with three terminals in a resistor-divider configuration providing direct control over an input level.
Pots come in many forms such as knobs, sliders, and trimer pots that require a small screwdriver for adjustment.

name: Relay
description: An electro-mechanical device similar to a switch, but whose on/off control is the output of another circuit.
Relays allow a low-power circuit to switch a higher power circuit on and off.

name: Gear motor
description: A motor connected through a gearbox to increase torque and slow down the output shaft to a manageable speed.

name: Solenoid
description: A linear actuator that can "pull" over a small distance.

name: Dynamo
description: Electric motors can work in reverse, generating power when their shaft is turned.

name: Fan
description: An electric motor whose shaft is connected directly to fan blades in order to move air.

name: Heater
description: An electric heater is a resistor with a specific shape! Making heat requires a lot of power.

name: Pump
description: An electro-mechanical device using a motor to move fluids.

name: Light Emitting Diode (LED)
description: LEDs produce light efficiently, and respond very quickly to in the power applied.

name: Incandescent lightbulb
description: Incandescent lightbulbs contain a fillament which gets so hot that it glows brightly. A non-reactive gas in the bulb prevents the fillament from burning up too quickly.
Their light output is slow to change, and waste most of their energy as heat

name: Buzzer
description: A noise-maker! No audio signal required, just apply power and it makes a very annoying tone all on its own.

name: Speaker
description: Speakers convert electrical energy into audible sound.

name: Speaker as microphone
description: Speakers can work in reverse, generating power when the air vibrates.
Push-to-talk intercom systems often use a single speaker for both output and input.

name: Impulse counter
description: An electro-mechanical device which increments the displayed number each time an electrical pulse is applied.

name: Vibrator
description: Vibrators are tiny motors with an off-centre weight attached to the shaft.

name: Force-sensitive resistor (FSR)
description: A pressure-sensitive device kind of like an analog switch: its output varries with the force applied.

name: Moisture sensor
description: Water in soil conducts electricity, so its moisture level can be approximated by measuring how much electricity can flow through it.

name: Electret microphone
description: A very small, sensitive, and low-cost type of microphone commonly used phones and headsets.

name: Dynamic microphone
description: A speaker in reverse! Dynamic microphones turn vibrations in the air into electrical signals.

name: Reed switch
description: A physical switch which is activated when near a magnet. Commonly used on windows and doors for alarm systems.

name: Hall effect sensor
description: A magnetic field detector with very fast response time.
Common use-case: counting rotations of a motor shaft with a magnet attached.

name: Thermistor
description: A simple, low-accuracy temperature sensor with a wide working range.

name: Coil
description: A coil of wire can detect changing electromagnetic fields in the air
